analyzed: me'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: des na de ji ltar rtogs pa tsam yin /
analyzed: des na de ji ltar rtogs pa tsam yin /

original: shes pa'i rnam pa nyid yin na ni ;
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa nyid yin na ni ;

original: du ba yang me'i 'bras bur mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: du ba yang me'i 'bras bur mi 'grub ste /

analyzed: shes pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
translated: because it produces consciousness. This is the opponentâ€™s thought.

original: brjod de zhes bya ba ni bram zes so //

analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni ngo shes pa'i stobs kyis rnam par rig pa tsam bzlog pa nyid ston pa'o //
translated: â€œIn this wayâ€ shows the mere cognition is refuted by the power of recognition.

original: gal te don myong ba'i nang du 'dus na /
analyzed: gal te don myong ba'i nang du 'dus na /
translated: If the object is included in the experience,

original: de'i tshe ngo shes pa'i yul gang yin ngo shes pa la yul yod pa la yang yin te /ğŸ”½thams cad du na phyi rol dmigs //
analyzed: de'i tshe ngo shes pa'i yul gang yin ngo shes pa la yul yod pa la yang yin te / thams cad du na phyi rol dmigs //

analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni don gyi dbye ba rgyu mtshan med pa'o //
translated: That is the division of the meaning, which is without a reason.

analyzed: 'o na don gyis g-yo ba'i rgyu shes pa'i dbye ba yin mong snyam na /

original: shes pa'i dbye ba las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i dbye ba las zhes bya ba'o //

original: ma 'brel ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'brel ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: mi snang ba'i bag chags tha dad par byed pa la yang nyes pa ni de la zhes bya ba ste /

original: mi snang ba la yod do //
analyzed: mi snang ba la yod do //
translated: Non-appearance is not possible.

original: gzung ba tha dad par ni skyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzung ba tha dad par ni skyed par mi 'gyur ro //

original: dran pa tsam nyid kyi gzung ba'i rnam par bskyed par ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: dran pa tsam nyid kyi gzung ba'i rnam par bskyed par ni ma mthong ngo //

original: de'i zhes bya ba rang gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyed par byed pa sngon gyi rnam par shes pa de ji ltar tha dad par byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba rang gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyed par byed pa sngon gyi rnam par shes pa de ji ltar tha dad par byed pa ma yin /
translated: How is it that the previous consciousness, which produces the consciousness having its own form, does not produce a different [consciousness]?

original: lcags sgrog gis bcings pa'i bdag nyid med kyang de lta bu'i tshul du zhes bya ba 'khor ba'i tshul du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du bag chags kyi dbye bas kyang yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: lcags sgrog gis bcings pa'i bdag nyid med kyang de lta bu'i tshul du zhes bya ba 'khor ba'i tshul du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du bag chags kyi dbye bas kyang yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Although there is no self that is bound by iron fetters, in that way, the cause of going in the mode of cyclic existence is the division of latent impressions.

original: der yang ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: der yang ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: There, desire, etc.

original: gal te der phyi rol nyid dmigs pa yin na /

translated: If external objects are observed there,

original: de'i tshe de nyid na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe de nyid na zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: dus de'i tshe yul der ro //

analyzed: de ni yul dang dus gzhan du med pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not exist in another place and time,

analyzed: med pa'i phyir ma thob pa ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o // yul la sogs pa yis /

analyzed: gzhan nyid yin par ji ltar 'gyur //

original: zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ji ltar snang ba de ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ji ltar snang ba de ni /

analyzed: des na yul dang dus 'di pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is understood to be just in this place and time,

analyzed: de ni yul dang dus 'di pa nyid do //

translated: The response is: â€œIn another aspect,â€ that is, in the aspect of yellow, there is no valid cognition to prove that the appearance in the aspect of blue is itself yellow. Therefore, blue is not in the aspect of yellow.

analyzed: yul dang dus gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir gsungs so //

analyzed: 'di la pha rol pos rnam pa la ni zhes smras so //

translated: If you say that it is difficult to stop the object of perception because the object and the person who perceives it are not seen to be absent there, then we reply: â€œThe connection . . .â€

original: 'di la lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //

original: bab col nyid ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bab col nyid ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //

original: thams cad 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œBecause everything would be like thatâ€ means

analyzed: ji ltar zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa log par snang ba de bzhin du bden pa'i ka ba la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa thams cad 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i yul can nyid du bstan pas so //

analyzed: 'di la @260b brjod pa ni gnod par byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the reply to that is â€œThe consciousness that invalidates . . .â€

analyzed: de lta na yang de nged las don rnam par gnas par ji ltar 'gyur /

analyzed: de'i phyir gnod byed med pa ste /

original: gang du dus gzhan du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang du dus gzhan du zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: de ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, â€œThat.â€

analyzed: bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni bsgo byed med par bsgrub pa la 'di bstan na 'gal ba yin no //
translated: â€œThe proof of the oppositeâ€ is taught in order to establish the absence of the cause. If this is taught, there is a contradiction.

original: des na dran pa'i shes pa na /
analyzed: des na dran pa'i shes pa na /
translated: Therefore, in the cognition of memory,

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /

analyzed: rtag pa zhes smos te /

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / snga ma bzhin du gnas pa de la ni bag chags su 'gyur ba ma yin te /

original: 'di la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: gzhan ba lang gi blos bar du chod na yang sngar gyi glang po'i blo ni phyis kyi glang po'i blo brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ba lang gi blos bar du chod na yang sngar gyi glang po'i blo ni phyis kyi glang po'i blo brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the mental continuum of a cow intervenes, the mental continuum of an elephant is the basis of the later mental continuum of an elephant.

original: 'on te glang po'i blo ni shin tu yang chod pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'on te glang po'i blo ni shin tu yang chod pa'i phyir na /
translated: But since the mental continuum of an elephant is very distant,

original: de bag chags su ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de bag chags su ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: how can it be a latent potentiality?

original: brtan pa sgrub byed ces smos so //
analyzed: brtan pa sgrub byed ces smos so //
translated: The response to this is â€œbecause it is the cause of the establishment of stability.â€

original: 'o na glang po'i blo de las skyes snyam na glang po'i shes pas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na glang po'i blo de las skyes snyam na glang po'i shes pas zhes gsungs so //
translated: But if it is asked, â€œIs it produced from the mental continuum of an elephant?â€ the response is â€œby the consciousness of an elephant.â€

original: 'o na bar du ba lang gi blo gang las skyes snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na bar du ba lang gi blo gang las skyes snyam na /
translated: But if it is asked, â€œFrom what is the mental continuum of a cow produced in the interim?â€

original: bar du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bar du zhes gsungs so //
translated: the response is â€œin the interim.â€

original: de ltar re zhig rang nyid 'dod pa'i bag chags rnam par bzhag nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rang nyid 'dod pa'i bag chags rnam par bzhag nas /
translated: Thus, having presented the latent potentialities that are accepted by ourselves,

original: slob dpon chos mchog la sogs pas 'dod pa'i bag chags rnams ni /
analyzed: slob dpon chos mchog la sogs pas 'dod pa'i bag chags rnams ni /
translated: the latent potentialities that are accepted by the master Dharmottara and so on

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: are the essence of the prior consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma zhig na bag chags mtha' dag 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa'i skyon yod pa ni zhig @261b pa gcig ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma zhig na bag chags mtha' dag 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa'i skyon yod pa ni zhig @261b pa gcig ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The fault of saying that all the latent impressions would be destroyed when a previous consciousness is destroyed is stated in the line â€œWhen one is destroyed, the other would not be there.â€

original: gal te gcig zhig pa na de'i nus pa rnams kyang 'jig na ni /
analyzed: gal te gcig zhig pa na de'i nus pa rnams kyang 'jig na ni /
translated: If when one is destroyed, the other would be destroyed,

original: de'i tshe rgya skyegs kyi khu bar spangs pa'i me tog zhig pa na /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgya skyegs kyi khu bar spangs pa'i me tog zhig pa na /
translated: then when the flower is destroyed, having abandoned the lac liquid,

original: 'bras bu dmar po ga las skyes //
analyzed: 'bras bu dmar po ga las skyes //
translated: how could the red fruit arise?

original: 'on te sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa las 'bras bu dmar po skye'i me tog las ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa las 'bras bu dmar po skye'i me tog las ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the red fruit arises from the seed, sprout, and so on, and not from the flower,

original: sa bon zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sa bon zhes gsungs so //
translated: then the seed is said.

original: 'bras bu dmar po dang mi mthun pa las dmar po ji ltar skye zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'bras bu dmar po dang mi mthun pa las dmar po ji ltar skye zhes 'brel to //
translated: How could the red arise from that which is not concordant with the red fruit?

original: 'on te sa bon la sogs pa de yang me tog dmar po des bskyed pa na /
analyzed: 'on te sa bon la sogs pa de yang me tog dmar po des bskyed pa na /
translated: But if that seed and so on is generated by that red flower,

original: rim gyis 'bras bu'i byed pa po yin no snyam na /
analyzed: rim gyis 'bras bu'i byed pa po yin no snyam na /
translated: then it is the agent of the fruit in a gradual process.

original: 'di na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di na zhes gsungs so //
translated: Then here is said.

original: rgyu de'i phyir bag chags 'di dag thams cad las rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i shes pa skyes pa ni skad cig gcig nyid kyis 'jig par 'gyur ba mi rigs pas so //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir bag chags 'di dag thams cad las rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i shes pa skyes pa ni skad cig gcig nyid kyis 'jig par 'gyur ba mi rigs pas so //
translated: For that reason, it is not reasonable that a consciousness endowed with all aspects arises from all of these habitual propensities in a single moment.

original: gal te nus pa rnams kyi rten zhig na /
analyzed: gal te nus pa rnams kyi rten zhig na /
translated: If the basis of the potentialities is destroyed,

original: gdon mi za bar nus pa 'jig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar nus pa 'jig pa'i phyir /
translated: then the potentialities must certainly be destroyed.

original: rnam par shes pa ci zhig pa na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ci zhig pa na /
translated: If consciousness is destroyed,

original: nus pa rnams kyang 'jig par 'gyur dgos so ;
analyzed: nus pa rnams kyang 'jig par 'gyur dgos so ;
translated: then the potentialities must also be destroyed.ğŸ”½Even so, all consciousnesses would be destroyed.

original: / de lta na yang rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang zhig pa yin no snyam na de ston zhes smos so //
analyzed: / de lta na yang rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang zhig pa yin no snyam na de ston zhes smos so //
translated: To respond to that, it is said, â€œIf that is so . . .â€ğŸ”½It follows that the potentialities would be permanent.

original: 'o na nus pa rtag par thal lo zhe na nus pa tha dad ces gsungs te /
analyzed: 'o na nus pa rtag par thal lo zhe na nus pa tha dad ces gsungs te /
translated: To respond to that, it is said, â€œThe potentialities are different . . . â€

original: shes pa las tha mi dad pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa las tha mi dad pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not different from consciousness.

original: 'on te rnam par shes pa'i rgyu bzhin du bag chags kyi rgyun yang srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par shes pa'i rgyu bzhin du bag chags kyi rgyun yang srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, because it is possible for the continuum of the habitual propensities to be like the cause of consciousness,

original: bag chags dang shes pa gnyi ga las rnam par shes pa du ma dus gcig nyid bskyed par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bag chags dang shes pa gnyi ga las rnam par shes pa du ma dus gcig nyid bskyed par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that consciousness is produced from both latent impressions and consciousness,

original: 'di la brjod pa ni bag chags ldan pa rnams zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni bag chags ldan pa rnams zhes gsungs so //
translated: then we reply that it is said that those who possess latent impressions.

original: bag chags kyi rgyun mi 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: bag chags kyi rgyun mi 'dod pa yin te /
translated: We do not accept a continuum of latent impressions.

original: gang gi phyir bag chags ni nus pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bag chags ni nus pa yin te /
translated: Because a latent impression is a potentiality,

original: nus pa yang sa bon la sogs pa bzhin du rgyun du 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pa yang sa bon la sogs pa bzhin du rgyun du 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: and a potentiality does not occur in a continuum, like a seed, etc.

original: da ni bag chags las ni shes pa shes pa las kyang bag chags yin pas phan tshun brten pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro zhes gzhan gyis brjod pa yod pa ni /
analyzed: da ni bag chags las ni shes pa shes pa las kyang bag chags yin pas phan tshun brten pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro zhes gzhan gyis brjod pa yod pa ni /

original: bag chags las ni mngon par 'dod pa'i shes pa skye zhing /
analyzed: bag chags las ni mngon par 'dod pa'i shes pa skye zhing /

original: shes pa gzhan de dag las kyang bag chags yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan de dag las kyang bag chags yin gyi /

original: shes pa dang bag chags de dang mtshungs pa nyid du ste /
analyzed: shes pa dang bag chags de dang mtshungs pa nyid du ste /
translated: But consciousness and latent impressions are not simultaneous.

original: dus nyid du ni nam yang phan tshun byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dus nyid du ni nam yang phan tshun byed pa ma yin no //
translated: They are never reciprocal causes.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa mtshungs par skyed par byed pa'i bag chags yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa mtshungs par skyed par byed pa'i bag chags yin na /
translated: If the latent impressions are the cause of the production of consciousness,

original: de'i tshe gang gi tshe ser po'i shes pa las sngon po'i shes pa skye ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i tshe gang gi tshe ser po'i shes pa las sngon po'i shes pa skye ba de'i tshe /

original: ser po'i shes pa bag chags su mi @262a * //
analyzed: ser po'i shes pa bag chags su mi @262a * //

original: 'gyur te mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur te mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is not similar to the consciousness of blue.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni nus pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rgyu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni nus pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rgyu zhes bya ba'o //

original: 'dis ni gang gis sngon po'i shes pa skyed par byed pa ser po'i shes pa nyid la sngon po'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa de 'dra ba gzhan nyid yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gang gis sngon po'i shes pa skyed par byed pa ser po'i shes pa nyid la sngon po'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa de 'dra ba gzhan nyid yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the consciousness of yellow itself has another potentiality that generates the consciousness of blue, by means of which it generates the consciousness of blue.

original: mjug sdud pa ni de phyir ldog par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mjug sdud pa ni de phyir ldog par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The conclusion is stated in the line â€œTherefore, it is reversed.â€

original: dngos ni bag chags 'di yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos ni bag chags 'di yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The actual response is that these latent impressions do not exist.

original: de las kyang ni zhes bya ba bag chags las kyang 'bras bu gzhan ci'i phyir mi srid de srid pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de las kyang ni zhes bya ba bag chags las kyang 'bras bu gzhan ci'i phyir mi srid de srid pa kho na'o //
translated: The response to the second objection is stated in the line â€œAnd from that too.â€ Why is it not possible for another effect to arise from the latent impressions? It is certainly possible.

original: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: As for the words â€œif it is notâ€ and so on,

original: bram ze'i lugs las sun 'byin pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bram ze'i lugs las sun 'byin pa brjod pa ni /
translated: the refutation of the brahminâ€™s position is stated.

original: bram ze de'i lugs la ni /
analyzed: bram ze de'i lugs la ni /
translated: In the brahminâ€™s position,

original: bdag la sogs pa 'ga' yang bag chags 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa 'ga' yang bag chags 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: nothing such as the self holds the latent impressions,

original: bdag ni rtag pas na sngar bzhin du phyis kyang 'dzin byed du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ni rtag pas na sngar bzhin du phyis kyang 'dzin byed du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the self is permanent, and so it would not become a holder later on, just as it was before.

original: bag chags su yang de 'dod min //
analyzed: bag chags su yang de 'dod min //
translated: And he does not assert the latent impressions.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: rten med pa na brten par 'gyur ba'i bag chags kyang mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rten med pa na brten par 'gyur ba'i bag chags kyang mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And it is not tenable that the latent impressions exist without a basis.

original: nged kyi phyogs la ni 'thad pa nyid do zhes ston pa ni me tog ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: nged kyi phyogs la ni 'thad pa nyid do zhes ston pa ni me tog ces bya ba'o //
translated: The words â€œlike a flowerâ€ show that our position is tenable.

original: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rgya skyegs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni 'bras bu ma du lung ga la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rgya skyegs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni 'bras bu ma du lung ga la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words â€œits natureâ€ refer to the nature of lac and so on. The nature of the fruit, such as the madÄlaka, is the nature of the seed.

original: rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba can no //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba can no //
translated: â€œDifferentiatedâ€ means that it is differentiated as blue, yellow, etc.

original: phyi rol don med ces bya ba phyi'i yul dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol don med ces bya ba phyi'i yul dang bral ba'o //
translated: â€œWithout external objectsâ€ means that it is devoid of external objects.

original: mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The conclusion is â€œTherefore . . .â€

original: tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: â€œIt is a valid cognitionâ€ is the statement of DignÄga.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i phyogs snga ma 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i phyogs snga ma 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation of the opponentâ€™s position beginning with â€œIf . . .â€ is â€œIt is not . . .â€

original: don zhes bya ba ni shes pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni shes pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œMeaningâ€ is because of not understanding the meaning of â€œall consciousnesses . . .â€

original: 'o na don de gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na don de gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is that meaning?

original: tshad mas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshad mas zhes gsungs so //
translated: â€œBy a valid cognitionâ€ is stated.ğŸ”½â€œBy a valid cognitionâ€ is not a reason, because it is known.

original: tshad mas zhes bya ba gtan tshigs shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs phyogs zhes bya ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad mas zhes bya ba gtan tshigs shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs phyogs zhes bya ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œPositionâ€ is â€œIt is not . . .â€

original: dpe zhes bya ba rmi lam gyi shes pa dmigs pa med pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dpe zhes bya ba rmi lam gyi shes pa dmigs pa med pa nyid ni /
translated: The example is the non-apprehension of the consciousness in a dream.

original: rang nyid grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the establishment of itself.

original: shes pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa rigs pa ldan no //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa rigs pa ldan no //
translated: The statement â€œall consciousnessesâ€ and so on is reasonable.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni shes pa thams cad ni dmigs pa med pa yin te zhes bya ba 'di'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni shes pa thams cad ni dmigs pa med pa yin te zhes bya ba 'di'o //
translated: â€œThisâ€ refers to the statement â€œall consciousnesses are non-apprehension.â€

original: ji ltar khyab pa grub ces bya ba gang dang gang shes @262b pa yin pa de thams cad dmigs pa med pa yin no zhes ci ltar grub snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar khyab pa grub ces bya ba gang dang gang shes @262b pa yin pa de thams cad dmigs pa med pa yin no zhes ci ltar grub snyam na /
translated: How is the pervasion established? How is it established that whatever is consciousness is necessarily non-apprehension?

original: rigs gang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs gang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œWhatever is a reasonâ€ means

original: 'di ni rmi lam gyi shes pa goms pa tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed par mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni rmi lam gyi shes pa goms pa tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed par mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: because it is seen that the mere acquaintance with the consciousness in a dream conforms with the positive and negative concomitance.

analyzed: shes pa thams cad kyang de lta bu nyid yin no zhes bya ba khyab pa grub po zhes dogs so ;
translated: Therefore, the pervasion is established, that is, that all consciousnesses are like that.

original: / de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it were not so,

analyzed: gal te de'i rigs can nyid yin yang des bskyed ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Even if it is of the same type, it is not necessarily produced by that.

analyzed: gal te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the state of being cause and effect does not follow from the concomitance and the reverse concomitance,

analyzed: des na rigs gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pa 'jug par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: In that case, how could the reasoning that goes â€œIf it is of the same type . . . â€ be applicable?

original: rgyu dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The root text responds, â€œThe cause . . . â€

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa ni re zhig bag chags kyis bskyed pa yin la /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa ni re zhig bag chags kyis bskyed pa yin la /
translated: The consciousness in a dream is produced by latent potentialities.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba yin no zhes ston pa ni ;
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba yin no zhes ston pa ni ;
translated: The root text shows that other consciousnesses are like that:

translated: For that reason, other waking consciousnesses are also like that, that is, they are produced by habituation.

original: gzhan tshe zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan tshe zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œ At another timeâ€ refers to

original: rmi lam gyi de ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi de ma thag tu'o //
translated: the time immediately after a dream.

original: de'am zhes bya ba ni rmi lam mthong ba'am lan pa'i skyes bus so //

translated: â€œ Thatâ€ refers to the person who has seen the dream or is waking up.

analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni rmi lam mthong ba'i dus nyid na'o //
translated: â€œ At that timeâ€ refers to the time when the dream is seen.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus de na nye bar gnas pa'i sad pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus de na nye bar gnas pa'i sad pa rnams kyis so //
translated: â€œ Othersâ€ refers to those who are awake and are present in that place and time.

original: rgyu de'i phyir na rmi lam gyi shes pa de ni dmigs pa med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir na rmi lam gyi shes pa de ni dmigs pa med pa yin gyi /

translated: It is not because it is consciousness that it does not have an object.

original: des na ji ltar khyab pa 'grub ces bsams pa'o //ğŸ”½sad pa'i gnod byed kyi shes pa gang yin pa des ni /
analyzed: des na ji ltar khyab pa 'grub ces bsams pa'o // sad pa'i gnod byed kyi shes pa gang yin pa des ni /
translated: So how can you establish a pervasion?ğŸ”½The consciousness that is undermined by waking consciousness

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa de'i dmigs pa bzlog par byas pas na'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa de'i dmigs pa bzlog par byas pas na'o //
translated: reverses the object of the dream consciousness.

original: 'on te rmi lam gyi shes pa bzhin du sad pa'i shes pa la yang gnod par byed pa yod la des na /ğŸ”½sad pa'i shes pa yang dmigs pa med pa nyid yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas pha rol po'i lan nyid smra ba ni /
analyzed: 'on te rmi lam gyi shes pa bzhin du sad pa'i shes pa la yang gnod par byed pa yod la des na / sad pa'i shes pa yang dmigs pa med pa nyid yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas pha rol po'i lan nyid smra ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the consciousness in the waking state is also devoid of an object.ğŸ”½In response to this objection, the opponentâ€™s response is stated:

original: rmi lam gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œLike the consciousness in a dream, the consciousness in the waking state is also impaired.â€

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa de ji ltar dpe yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa de ji ltar dpe yin te /
translated: How can the consciousness in a dream be an example?

original: rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is of a different type.

original: 'di la rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di la rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two alternatives here:

original: gnod par byed pa sad pa'i shes pas @263a * //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa sad pa'i shes pas @263a * //
translated: The consciousness in the waking state, which is the impairment,

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa'i yul dbrog par bya ba'am /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa'i yul dbrog par bya ba'am /
translated: either takes away the object of the consciousness in a dream,

original: yul med par shes par bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: yul med par shes par bya ba ma yin /
translated: or it makes one understand that the object does not exist.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa dang po la brjod pa ni gnod byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa dang po la brjod pa ni gnod byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: With regard to the first alternative, the response is: â€œThe impairment.â€

original: 'o na ji ltar zhes dris pa la brjod pa ni shes par bya ba nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhes dris pa la brjod pa ni shes par bya ba nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: â€œWell then, how?â€ In response to this question, it is stated: â€œIt is understood.â€

original: 'di la ni rmi lam gyi shes pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni rmi lam gyi shes pa la'o //
translated: Here, â€œin a dreamâ€ refers to the consciousness in a dream.

original: gzhan gyis ni sad pa'i shes pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni sad pa'i shes pas so //
translated: â€œBy anotherâ€ refers to the consciousness in the waking state.

original: gal te 'gal zla med par sgrub par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'gal zla med par sgrub par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isnâ€™t there also the perception of a contradiction that proves the absence of a contradictory object?

original: des na ji ltar mi dmigs pa kho na med pa sgrub par byed pa yin zhes brjod snyam na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar mi dmigs pa kho na med pa sgrub par byed pa yin zhes brjod snyam na /
translated: So why do you say that non-apprehension alone proves non-existence?

original: 'gal ba yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'gal ba yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response to that is, â€œEven a contradiction . . .â€

original: rmi lam shes pa la snang ba'i gzhal bya las gzhal bya gzhan dmigs pa nyid sad pa nyid shes pa gnod byed yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam shes pa la snang ba'i gzhal bya las gzhal bya gzhan dmigs pa nyid sad pa nyid shes pa gnod byed yin no //
translated: The object of comprehension that appears to the consciousness of a dream is different from the object of comprehension that is perceived when one awakens.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i shes pas dmigs pa'i gzhal bya las gzhal bya gzhan dmigs pa nyid ni rmi lam gyi shes pa la yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i shes pas dmigs pa'i gzhal bya las gzhal bya gzhan dmigs pa nyid ni rmi lam gyi shes pa la yang yod pa yin te /
translated: The response to that is, â€œThat . . .â€ The object of comprehension that is perceived by the consciousness of an awake person is different from the object of comprehension that is perceived by the consciousness of a dream.ğŸ”½So why isnâ€™t the consciousness of an awake person undermined by the consciousness of a dream?

original: des na rmi lam gyi shes pa nyid sad pa'i shes pa gnod par byed pa ci ltar ma yin de ni sad pa'i shes pa la yang thams cad yod pa yin no zhes 'don par ni bum pa dang snam bu'i yul can sad pa'i shes pa dag kho
analyzed: des na rmi lam gyi shes pa nyid sad pa'i shes pa gnod par byed pa ci ltar ma yin de ni sad pa'i shes pa la yang thams cad yod pa yin no zhes 'don par ni bum pa dang snam bu'i yul can sad pa'i shes pa dag kho
translated: The response to that is, â€œThat . . .â€ The object of comprehension that is perceived by the consciousness of an awake person is different from the object of comprehension that is perceived by the consciousness of a dream.

original: na phan tshun ltos nas gzhal bya dmigs pa yin pa'i phan tshun gnod byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: na phan tshun ltos nas gzhal bya dmigs pa yin pa'i phan tshun gnod byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and the object of one is not the object of the other.

original: bum pa la sogs pa gcig dmigs nas bum pa la sogs pa gzhan dmigs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa gcig dmigs nas bum pa la sogs pa gzhan dmigs pa'i dus na /
translated: When one vase is observed, and another vase is observed,

original: ngas dmigs pa'i bum pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes de ltar sad pa'i shes pa la mi 'gyur ba des na /
analyzed: ngas dmigs pa'i bum pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes de ltar sad pa'i shes pa la mi 'gyur ba des na /
translated: the consciousness of the waking state does not think, â€œThe vase that I observed before is not the vase that I am observing now.â€

original: ji ltar bum pa'i shes pa gzhan gyi gnod par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa'i shes pa gzhan gyi gnod par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: So how could the cognition of one vase be undermined by the cognition of another vase?

original: rmi lam gyi shes pas dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pas dmigs pa ni /
translated: The object observed by the consciousness in a dream

original: sad pa'i shes pa dus nas bdag gis mthong ba de ni brdzun yin no zhes lhag par zhen te des na rmi lam gyi shes pas dmigs pa sad pa'i shes pas gnod do zhes rigs kyi bzlog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /ğŸ”½gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
analyzed: sad pa'i shes pa dus nas bdag gis mthong ba de ni brdzun yin no zhes lhag par zhen te des na rmi lam gyi shes pas dmigs pa sad pa'i shes pas gnod do zhes rigs kyi bzlog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni / gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
translated: is ascertained by the consciousness upon waking, which thinks, â€œWhat I saw was false.â€ Therefore, the object observed by the consciousness in a dream is undermined by the consciousness upon waking.ğŸ”½This is the opponentâ€™s view.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is as follows.

original: rig pa'i 'bras bu ni 'di ni de ltar yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rig pa'i 'bras bu ni 'di ni de ltar yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The effect of awareness is â€œit is like this.â€

original: rig pa med pa'i 'bras bu ni 'di ni de ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rig pa med pa'i 'bras bu ni 'di ni de ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The effect of non-awareness is â€œit is not like this.â€

original: de las cir 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur snyam na /
translated: What follows from that?

original: de na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de na zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, â€œIn that case . . .â€

original: gal te rig pa ma skyes na de'i 'bras bu nyid mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gal te rig pa ma skyes na de'i 'bras bu nyid mi 'thad do //
translated: If awareness does not arise, its effect is not tenable.

analyzed: de na 'bras @263b bu nyid mthong ba las rig pa rjes su dpog go zhes ston pa ni rig pa med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He shows that in that case, awareness is inferred from seeing its effect: â€œIn the absence of awareness . . .â€

original: 'di la brjod pa rang rig pas sngon po'i rnam par rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa rang rig pas sngon po'i rnam par rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here he says, â€œIt is because of the awareness of blue.â€ğŸ”½â€œIn that very thingâ€ means in its own nature.

original: de nyid la zhes bya ba rang gi rang bzhin nyid la 'di blta'o //
analyzed: de nyid la zhes bya ba rang gi rang bzhin nyid la 'di blta'o //
translated: One should see this.

original: 'di ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur gyi don la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur gyi don la ni ma yin te /
translated: One would understand â€œit is not like this,â€ but not the object.

original: des na ji ltar 'bras bu rang gi ngo bo la gnas te de bzhin du mngon sum du rig pa yang rang gi rig pa tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: des na ji ltar 'bras bu rang gi ngo bo la gnas te de bzhin du mngon sum du rig pa yang rang gi rig pa tsam yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, just as the effect abides in its own nature, in the same way, the awareness of direct perception is just the awareness of itself.

original: don rig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don rig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the cognition of the object.

original: de'i de ma thag tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i de ma thag tu byung ba'o //
translated: It arises immediately after that.ğŸ”½The effect is not like that.

original: 'bras bu 'di ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i rnam pa can rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa skyes pa na /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'di ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i rnam pa can rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa skyes pa na /
translated: When a conceptual cognition arises with such a form,

original: don de'i go byed du 'gyur gyi gzhan du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don de'i go byed du 'gyur gyi gzhan du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: it becomes the conveyor of the meaning of that object, not otherwise.

original: gal te don rig go ma shes na /
analyzed: gal te don rig go ma shes na /
translated: If the cognition of the object is not known,

original: de'i go byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i go byed pa ma yin no //
translated: it does not convey that.

original: de ni sad pa'i shes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ni sad pa'i shes pa'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of the cognition of the awakened one.

original: gzhan ni skyes bu gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: gzhan ni skyes bu gzhan gyis so //
translated: Another is by another person.

original: lan ni rmi lam du yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni rmi lam du yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: Even in a dream.

original: de yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyid log pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyid log pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Because of that existence, the cognition of sleep.

original: sems 'di ni gnyid kyis ma nyams par byas pa yin no zhes de ltar rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems 'di ni gnyid kyis ma nyams par byas pa yin no zhes de ltar rtogs pa ma yin no //

original: 'di la brjod pa ni thams cad ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni thams cad ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here it is said: All.

original: khyed kyi brjod pa ni rnam par dbye ba gang yin pa rmi lam gyi shes pa la ni sad pa'i shes pas gnod par byed pa nyid yin la rmi lam gyi shes pa shes pa ni sad pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: khyed kyi brjod pa ni rnam par dbye ba gang yin pa rmi lam gyi shes pa la ni sad pa'i shes pas gnod par byed pa nyid yin la rmi lam gyi shes pa shes pa ni sad pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Your statement that the discrimination is invalidated by the cognition of waking is not so, because the cognition of waking is the cognition of the dream.

analyzed: gnod byed ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin 'di gang gis kyang ma yin no //
translated: And the cognition of the dream is not invalidated by the cognition of waking.

analyzed: 'on te sad pa dag la ni yid ches pa mthong ste /

analyzed: des na sad pa'i shes pa nyid gnod par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and therefore the cognition of waking alone is the invalidation,

original: rmi lam du yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rmi lam du yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: we say that in the case of dream also,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni yid ches pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni yid ches pa mthong ba'o //
translated: â€œthusâ€ means â€œseeing the credibility.â€

original: mi bden pa yin no zhes rmi lam du yang yid ches pa ma mthong ngam ci des na rmi lam yang bden pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi bden pa yin no zhes rmi lam du yang yid ches pa ma mthong ngam ci des na rmi lam yang bden pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Is it not seen that even in the case of dream, there is no credibility? Therefore, even dream would be true.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' ni bden pa zhes bya bar res 'ga' ni log pa ma yin no zhes yid ches pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' ni bden pa zhes bya bar res 'ga' ni log pa ma yin no zhes yid ches pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, means because it is seen that sometimes it is true, and sometimes it is not false.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni 'di yang zhes bya ba ste sad pa yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni 'di yang zhes bya ba ste sad pa yang ngo //
translated: Here, the response is this: means that even when awake.

original: der zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs su'o //ğŸ”½'di la lan ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs su'o // 'di la lan ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There means in the state of being awake.

original: der yang ni sad pa'i gnas skabs su yang yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa mthong ba mod la 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der yang ni sad pa'i gnas skabs su yang yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa mthong ba mod la 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: The response here is this: means that even there, in the state of being awake, the pleasant, etc. that are seen are immediately destroyed.

original: nyi ma gang la yid du 'ong ba mthong ba rgyun mi 'chad par te /
analyzed: nyi ma gang la yid du 'ong ba mthong ba rgyun mi 'chad par te /
translated: On the day when the pleasant, etc. are seen without interruption,

original: yun ring por mthong ba de lta bu'i nyi ma ni @264a * //
analyzed: yun ring por mthong ba de lta bu'i nyi ma ni @264a * //
translated: that is, for a long time,

original: rmi lam na yang yang ngo //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang yang ngo //
translated: such a day does not occur even in a dream.

original: phyogs dang dpe ma grub pa ni gang gi tshe rmi lam dang rmi lam ma yin pa dag rnam par grub pa de'i tshe sad pa'i shes pa ni phyogs yin la rmi lam gyi shes pa ni dpe yin no zhes grub pa zhig na gang gi tshe tha
analyzed: phyogs dang dpe ma grub pa ni gang gi tshe rmi lam dang rmi lam ma yin pa dag rnam par grub pa de'i tshe sad pa'i shes pa ni phyogs yin la rmi lam gyi shes pa ni dpe yin no zhes grub pa zhig na gang gi tshe tha
translated: The nonestablishment of the example and the predicate is as follows: When a dream and a non-dream are established, then the consciousness of the waking state is the predicate and the dream consciousness is the example.ğŸ”½But when the consciousness that establishes the difference is a valid cognition, then how are the example and the predicate established?

original: dad pa sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa tshad ma yin pa de'i tshe phyogs dang dpe dag ji ltar 'grub phyogs dang dpe ma grub mod gtan tshigs shes pa nyid la skyon ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: dad pa sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa tshad ma yin pa de'i tshe phyogs dang dpe dag ji ltar 'grub phyogs dang dpe ma grub mod gtan tshigs shes pa nyid la skyon ci yod snyam na /
translated: If you think, â€œAlthough the example and the predicate are not established, what is the fault in the reason, consciousness?â€

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid ces smras so //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid ces smras so //
translated: we say, â€œIt is devoid of an object.â€

original: de ni zhes bya ba rmi lam ma yin pa'i shes pa 'dod par bsgrub pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba rmi lam ma yin pa'i shes pa 'dod par bsgrub pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: â€œThatâ€ refers to the consciousness of the non-dream state, which is the consciousness that is to be established as the desired object.

original: gal te tshad ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma yin na /
translated: If it is a valid cognition,

original: dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba des na /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba des na /
translated: it would have an object.

original: shes pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs ma nges par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs ma nges par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore the reason, consciousness, would be indefinite.

original: tshad ma thams cad ces smos so //
analyzed: tshad ma thams cad ces smos so //
translated: We say, â€œAll valid cognitions.â€

original: 'o na ji ltar dmigs pa med pa nyid yin na tshad ma yin zhe na dmigs pa med pas kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar dmigs pa med pa nyid yin na tshad ma yin zhe na dmigs pa med pas kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Well then, if it is non-apprehension, how can it be a valid cognition?

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is clarified by â€œEven though there is no apprehension. . . . â€

original: gal te rmi lam dang gzhan pa'i shes pa dag gis tha dad pa'i dmigs pa dang bcas pa ma yin pas byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rmi lam dang gzhan pa'i shes pa dag gis tha dad pa'i dmigs pa dang bcas pa ma yin pas byas pa yin no //
translated: If the cognition in a dream and the cognition in the waking state are not different because they both have an object, then they are both valid cognitions or neither is.

original: de lta ma yin na tha dad pa ci byas snyam na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tha dad pa ci byas snyam na /
translated: Otherwise, what is the difference between them?

original: de gnyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: â€œ In that case, . . . the two . . . â€

original: sangs rgyas pas tha mi dad par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pas tha mi dad par sgrub par byed do //
translated: The Buddhist is proving that they are not different.

original: de'i tshe gzhan sangs rgyas pa la nyes pa ci yod /
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhan sangs rgyas pa la nyes pa ci yod /
translated: What is the fault for the Buddhist in that case?

original: chos can yin zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba tshad ma nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: chos can yin zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba tshad ma nyid kyi'o //
translated: â€œ The subject . . . â€ is the probandum of the valid cognition.

original: de ji ltar zhes bya ba ni brgal zhing brtag pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar zhes bya ba ni brgal zhing brtag pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: â€œ How? . . . â€ is the form of the objection.

original: de skad brgal zhing brtags pa na //
analyzed: de skad brgal zhing brtags pa na //
translated: When it is objected in this way,

original: bram zhes ji ltar brjod par bya //
analyzed: bram zhes ji ltar brjod par bya //
translated: how can you say, â€œIt is the sameâ€?

original: gal te rig byed tshad ma ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te rig byed tshad ma ma yin na /
translated: If the Vedas are not a valid cognition,

original: de'i tshe rig byed 'jig rten pa'i tshig dang 'dra ba'i phyir ji ltar rig byed de chos can yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe rig byed 'jig rten pa'i tshig dang 'dra ba'i phyir ji ltar rig byed de chos can yin par 'gyur /
translated: At that time, because the Vedas are similar to worldly speech, how could the Vedas be the subject?

original: 'on te dang po kho nar tshad ma nyid rab tu bsgrub po //
analyzed: 'on te dang po kho nar tshad ma nyid rab tu bsgrub po //
translated: But if you first establish the validity of the Vedas,

analyzed: tshad mas bsgrubs pa na yang tha dad par chos can 'grub po zhe na /
translated: and then establish the subject as distinct,

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the response to that is â€œIn that case . . .â€

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni brjod zin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni brjod zin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: â€œThisâ€ refers to the previously stated definition.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'o //
translated: â€œIf . . .â€ is the purpose.

original: 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œIt is not refutedâ€ is the response.

original: gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i tshig kyang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i tshig kyang ngo //
translated: â€œOthersâ€ refers to worldly speech.

original: de na de 'dra'i tha dad pas kyang ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de na de 'dra'i tha dad pas kyang ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of such a distinction?

original: gang gis 'jig rten pa las tha dad par grub pa de nyid tha dad par brjod par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gang gis 'jig rten pa las tha dad par grub pa de nyid tha dad par brjod par bya ba yin na /
translated: If it is established as distinct from the world, then it should be expressed as distinct.

original: 'di ni brjod par nus pa yang ma yin no zhes @264b dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brjod par nus pa yang ma yin no zhes @264b dgongs pa'o //
translated: But it is not possible to express it in that way, he thinks.

original: shes pa ni re zhig ces bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs su mngon par 'dod pa'i rmi lam du rab tu grub pa ni /
analyzed: shes pa ni re zhig ces bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs su mngon par 'dod pa'i rmi lam du rab tu grub pa ni /
translated: â€œConsciousnessâ€ refers to the consciousness that is accepted in the waking state.

original: sad pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i shes pa 'di las ci tha dad pa yin nam 'on te tha mi dad pa yin zhes rtogs pa na /
analyzed: sad pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i shes pa 'di las ci tha dad pa yin nam 'on te tha mi dad pa yin zhes rtogs pa na /
translated: The question is whether the consciousness that is established in a dream is different from the consciousness that exists in the waking state, or whether it is not different.

original: dam par te mchog tu ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar ba lta'o zhes bya ba yang mtshungs so zhes snga ma dang 'brel to //
analyzed: dam par te mchog tu ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar ba lta'o zhes bya ba yang mtshungs so zhes snga ma dang 'brel to //
translated: â€œJust asâ€ is connected with the previous sentence, â€œjust as it is supreme, that is how it is.â€

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni sad pa'i shes pa'o //ğŸ”½tha dad pa la zhes bya ba ni rmi lam dang rmi lam ma yin pa dag dmigs pa med pa dang / dmigs pa dang bcas pa dag gi khyad par yod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni sad pa'i shes pa'o // tha dad pa la zhes bya ba ni rmi lam dang rmi lam ma yin pa dag dmigs pa med pa dang / dmigs pa dang bcas pa dag gi khyad par yod pa'o //
translated: â€œOthersâ€ refers to the consciousness of the waking state.ğŸ”½â€œDifferenceâ€ refers to the difference between dream and non-dream, that is, the difference between the non-apprehension of objects and the apprehension of objects.

original: tha dad 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rmi lam ma yin pa rmi lam las tha dad par chos can nyid du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rmi lam ma yin pa rmi lam las tha dad par chos can nyid du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: â€œGrasping differenceâ€ refers to the grasping of non-dream as a real thing, as different from dream.

original: da lta zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dmigs pa med par grub pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: da lta zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dmigs pa med par grub pa'i dus na'o //
translated: â€œNowâ€ refers to the time when the non-apprehension of objects is established as the probandum.

original: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni khyed kyi yang rig byed tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa thun mong chos can nyid du rtogs par sngar gyur pa gang yin pa de tshad mar grub pa'i dus kyi tshe na /ğŸ”½tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni khyed kyi yang rig byed tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa thun mong chos can nyid du rtogs par sngar gyur pa gang yin pa de tshad mar grub pa'i dus kyi tshe na / tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: â€œIf that were soâ€ means that even for you, the Vedas would be a common subject for valid and invalid cognition, and that which was previously understood would be invalid at the time of establishing validity.

original: de bzhin du chos can rtogs pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos can rtogs pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And likewise, because the understanding of the subject is not valid cognition,

original: de'i sgo can tshad ma'i sgrub byed nyid kyang ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i sgo can tshad ma'i sgrub byed nyid kyang ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: the means of establishing validity that is based on that would also not be valid cognition.

original: rig byed tshad mar mi 'grub par ni ma zad de /
analyzed: rig byed tshad mar mi 'grub par ni ma zad de /
translated: Not only is it that the Vedas are not established as valid cognition,

original: bram ze'i gzhung dang sbyar na /
analyzed: bram ze'i gzhung dang sbyar na /
translated: when applied to the texts of the brahmins,

original: ri la sogs pa la me la sogs pa la yang sgrub par mi nus par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: ri la sogs pa la me la sogs pa la yang sgrub par mi nus par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
translated: it would also be impossible to establish fire and so on in relation to a mountain and so on.

original: des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is shown by â€œThereforeâ€¦â€

original: der yang dang por ni me med pa ni thun mong ba'i chos can rtogs pas so //
analyzed: der yang dang por ni me med pa ni thun mong ba'i chos can rtogs pas so //
translated: There also, first, the nonexistence of fire is understood as a common subject.

original: me grub pa'i dus ni sngar yod pa'i thun mong du rtogs pa tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: me grub pa'i dus ni sngar yod pa'i thun mong du rtogs pa tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: At the time of establishing fire, the previously existing common understanding is not valid cognition.

original: de sgo nas me rtogs pa yang tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dngos po chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sgo nas me rtogs pa yang tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dngos po chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the cognition of fire by that is not valid knowledge, then the object of the probandum and the object of the proof would be cut off.

original: de'i 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rig byed tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin par thun mong du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rig byed tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin par thun mong du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: â€œIts apprehensionâ€ is the common apprehension of the Vedas as valid knowledge and as not valid knowledge.

original: dus phyis tshad mar grub kyang tshad ma ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dus phyis tshad mar grub kyang tshad ma ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if it is established as valid knowledge later, it would not be invalid knowledge,

original: thun mong ba de nyid la lhag par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ba de nyid la lhag par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that commonality is established as superior.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe tshad ma yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe tshad ma yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well, when would it be valid knowledge?

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is, as it is said.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, â€œthatâ€ refers to the Vedas.

original: gang gi tshe chos can rig byed de nyid kyi rang bzhin dang tshad mar yang grub par byed pa de'i tshe rig byed de la tshad ma gang yin pa de dang bral bar chad mar sgrub pa'i shes pas 'dzin kyang @265a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos can rig byed de nyid kyi rang bzhin dang tshad mar yang grub par byed pa de'i tshe rig byed de la tshad ma gang yin pa de dang bral bar chad mar sgrub pa'i shes pas 'dzin kyang @265a * //
translated: When the nature of the subject, the Vedas, is established as valid knowledge, then, even though the cognition apprehending the Vedas is established as invalid knowledge,

original: ji ltar na sngar gyi thun mong bar rtogs pa tshad ma gyur /ğŸ”½rig byed tshad ma yin pa de las zhes bya ba thun mong ba las bzlog pa thun mong ma yin pa der 'dzin pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sngar gyi thun mong bar rtogs pa tshad ma gyur / rig byed tshad ma yin pa de las zhes bya ba thun mong ba las bzlog pa thun mong ma yin pa der 'dzin pa na /
translated: How could the former apprehension of the common object not be a valid cognition?ğŸ”½If the Vedas are a valid cognition, then when one apprehends the uncommon object that is the opposite of the common object,

original: de las bzlog pa zhes bya ba bzung ba bzhin du thun mong ma yin pa las bzlog pa'i gzhal bya gang yin pa thun mong ba zhes bya ba de bsal na /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa zhes bya ba bzung ba bzhin du thun mong ma yin pa las bzlog pa'i gzhal bya gang yin pa thun mong ba zhes bya ba de bsal na /
translated: then the object that is the opposite of that, that is, the common object, is excluded.

original: ji ltar sngar gyi thun mong bar 'dzin pa tshad ma ma yin par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar sngar gyi thun mong bar 'dzin pa tshad ma ma yin par mi 'gyur /
translated: How could the former apprehension of the common object not be a valid cognition?

original: rang gi ngo bos ni lhag par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni lhag par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that it is not a valid cognition due to its nature.

original: gal te tshad ma lhag ma grub na /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma lhag ma grub na /
translated: If the remaining valid cognitions are established,

original: shin tu yang thun mong bar 'dzin par tshad ma ma yin par byed par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: shin tu yang thun mong bar 'dzin par tshad ma ma yin par byed par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
translated: then it would be the case that the apprehension of the extremely common object is not a valid cognition.

original: rang gi ngo bos ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is indicated by â€œdue to its nature.â€

original: pha rol po rang gi ngo bo la yang lhag pa nyid du gzhung 'dzugs pa ni ma bzung ba na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol po rang gi ngo bo la yang lhag pa nyid du gzhung 'dzugs pa ni ma bzung ba na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponentâ€™s position that it is not the case that the nature of the object is excluded is stated in â€œif it is not apprehended.â€

original: rig byed kyi tshad mar de'i rang gi ngo bo kho na yin mod kyi /
analyzed: rig byed kyi tshad mar de'i rang gi ngo bo kho na yin mod kyi /
translated: Although the nature of that is indeed the valid knowledge of the Vedas,

original: 'on kyang thun mong bar chos can rtogs pas ma bzung ba des na /
analyzed: 'on kyang thun mong bar chos can rtogs pas ma bzung ba des na /
translated: nevertheless, since the subject is not apprehended by the common understanding,

original: lhag par brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhag par brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is said to be special. This is the meaning.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni ma bzung zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni ma bzung zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the statement is not apprehended.

original: rig byed kyi rang bzhin gyi tshad mas chos can rtogs pas ma bzung na de'i tshad mar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rig byed kyi rang bzhin gyi tshad mas chos can rtogs pas ma bzung na de'i tshad mar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If the subject is not apprehended by the valid knowledge of the nature of the Vedas, how can that be valid knowledge?

original: gal te rang bzhin thams cad gzung bas ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin thams cad gzung bas ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: If it is argued that all natures are not apprehended by valid knowledge,

original: 'on kyang thun mong bar rtogs pas rang bzhin 'ga' zhig gzung ba yin no ;
analyzed: 'on kyang thun mong bar rtogs pas rang bzhin 'ga' zhig gzung ba yin no ;
translated: but some natures are apprehended by the common understanding,

original: / de'i tshad ma ni de tsam gyis yin zhe na /
analyzed: / de'i tshad ma ni de tsam gyis yin zhe na /
translated: and that is the extent of its validity,

original: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: this is not refuted.

original: rang gi tshe des rang bzhin 'dzin pa de'i tshe rang bzhin mtha' dag gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi tshe des rang bzhin 'dzin pa de'i tshe rang bzhin mtha' dag gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that when it apprehends its own nature, at that time all natures would be apprehended.

original: de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chos gcig 'dzin pa na chos mtha' dag 'dzin par thal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chos gcig 'dzin pa na chos mtha' dag 'dzin par thal ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not so, that is, it is not the case that when one quality is apprehended, all qualities are apprehended.

original: chos rnams phan tshun dang chos can las kyang tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams phan tshun dang chos can las kyang tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because qualities are distinct from each other and from the subject.

original: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is not a refutation of that.

original: thug pa med pa nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: thug pa med pa nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: The expression of the infinite regress is

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When,

original: gang tshe tshad ma nyid la sogs pa'i chos rig byed las tha dad na de'i tshe rig byed dang chos can de'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: gang tshe tshad ma nyid la sogs pa'i chos rig byed las tha dad na de'i tshe rig byed dang chos can de'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: when the quality of being a valid cognition and so on is distinct from the Vedic injunction, then the application of the Vedic injunction and the subject

original: 'brel pa gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: would be a different connection.

original: de bzhin du sbyor ba yang gzhan du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyor ba yang gzhan du 'gyur la /
translated: Similarly, the application would be different,

original: sbyor ba gnyis pa dang sbyor ba yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: sbyor ba gnyis pa dang sbyor ba yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: and because the second application and the application are different,

original: chos kyi bslad pa mtha' med par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos kyi bslad pa mtha' med par 'gyur /
translated: the contamination of the quality would be infinite.ğŸ”½Of those two

original: de gnyis nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang rig byed gnyis kyi'o //
analyzed: de gnyis nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang rig byed gnyis kyi'o //
translated: means of those two, the valid cognition and the Vedic injunction.

original: de'i tshe ji ltar ldan pa tha dad par ma yin pa de bzhin du tshad ma nyid @265b kyang tha mi dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar ldan pa tha dad par ma yin pa de bzhin du tshad ma nyid @265b kyang tha mi dad par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, just as they are not different in their possession, in the same way, the valid cognitions would not be different,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no difference between them.

original: de ltar byas pas ji ltar khyod tshad ma tha mi dad par 'dod pa mi 'gal ba de bzhin du nged kyi chos tha mi dad pa yang 'dod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas pas ji ltar khyod tshad ma tha mi dad par 'dod pa mi 'gal ba de bzhin du nged kyi chos tha mi dad pa yang 'dod par bya ba'o //
translated: By doing it this way, just as you assert that valid cognitions are not different and are not contradictory, in the same way, we assert that phenomena are not different.

original: gal te tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la yang sngar gyi thun mong du 'dzin pa'i shes pa tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la yang sngar gyi thun mong du 'dzin pa'i shes pa tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If, in the position of nondifference, the previously common consciousness that apprehends does not become a valid cognition,

original: des na rjes su dpag pa mtha' yas dag 'chad pa ni so na 'dug go zhe na /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa mtha' yas dag 'chad pa ni so na 'dug go zhe na /
translated: then the explanation of the infinite inferences remains as it is.

original: sgro 'dogs kyis ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs kyis ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response to that is â€œBy superimposition. . . .â€

original: dpyad pas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig tu 'dzin pa'i dbang gis tha dad pa med pa ste /
analyzed: dpyad pas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig tu 'dzin pa'i dbang gis tha dad pa med pa ste /
translated: â€œBy analysisâ€ means that by the power of apprehending a single aspect, there is no difference.

original: thun mong ba nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir te /ğŸ”½ji ltar tshad ma yin /
analyzed: thun mong ba nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir te / ji ltar tshad ma yin /
translated: Because it is realized as common,ğŸ”½how can it be a valid cognition?

original: ci ltar 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can it be an apprehension?

original: me la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par can du gyur pa'i ri la sogs pa gzhan las tha dad par gzung ba yang tha mi dad par lhag par zhen pa'i sgro 'dogs kyi ngo bo las so //
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par can du gyur pa'i ri la sogs pa gzhan las tha dad par gzung ba yang tha mi dad par lhag par zhen pa'i sgro 'dogs kyi ngo bo las so //
translated: and the mountain, etc., which are qualified by the particularities of fire, etc., are apprehended as different from other things, but they are imagined to be non-different from the nature of the superimposition.

original: 'dis ni gal te mngon sum la thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po snang ba de lta na yang cha gang la de 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i cha de nyid la tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni gal te mngon sum la thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po snang ba de lta na yang cha gang la de 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i cha de nyid la tshad ma yin te /
translated: This shows that even if the uncommon thing appears to perception, it is a valid cognition only in regard to that part which it causes to engage.

original: des na dngos po gcig kyang gal te khyad par gzhan la mngon sum gyis 'jug par nus pa nyid du ma byas pa de yang cha 'ga' zhig la mngon sum gyis 'jug tu rung bar byas pa'i phyir tshad ma kho na yin no zhes bstan pa yin no
analyzed: des na dngos po gcig kyang gal te khyad par gzhan la mngon sum gyis 'jug par nus pa nyid du ma byas pa de yang cha 'ga' zhig la mngon sum gyis 'jug tu rung bar byas pa'i phyir tshad ma kho na yin no zhes bstan pa yin no
translated: Therefore, even a single thing, if it is not made capable of being engaged by perception in regard to another particularity, is still a valid cognition because it makes a part of it suitable to be engaged by perception.

original: // nga la yang 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni rmi lam ma yin pa dag tha dad par mngon par rlom par ro //
analyzed: // nga la yang 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni rmi lam ma yin pa dag tha dad par mngon par rlom par ro //
translated: In the phrase in the same way for me, too, the non-dream state is imagined to be different.

original: bram ze la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang shes pa thams cad ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: bram ze la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang shes pa thams cad ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Other schools, such as the Brahmins, argue as follows: All consciousnesses have objects.

original: shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rmi lam la sogs pa la gnod par byed pa sad pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhes ci ste sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rmi lam la sogs pa la gnod par byed pa sad pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhes ci ste sgrub par byed de /
translated: This is because they are consciousnesses, just like the consciousnesses of the waking state that invalidate the consciousnesses of dreams and so on.

original: sgrub par byed pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you ask why they prove this, they say it is because they are consciousnesses.

original: rmi lam shes pa las shes pa gzhan shes par 'brel to //
analyzed: rmi lam shes pa las shes pa gzhan shes par 'brel to //
translated: The consciousness of dreams is related to consciousnesses that are other than it.

original: pha rol zhes bya ba ni mchog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol zhes bya ba ni mchog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: The term â€œotherâ€ refers to something superior.

original: bden pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa sad pa'i shes pa ni dmigs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bden pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa sad pa'i shes pa ni dmigs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The consciousness of the waking state, which is asserted to be true, does not have an object.

original: 'di ltar lam gyi sgrub byed yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar lam gyi sgrub byed yin te /
translated: This is because it is the means of accomplishing the path.

original: 'di 'gal ba spyi mi 'khrul ba ci ltar yin zhes dris nas de ltar na yang dmigs pa med pa nyid du grub po zhes sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gal ba spyi mi 'khrul ba ci ltar yin zhes dris nas de ltar na yang dmigs pa med pa nyid du grub po zhes sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: If you ask how it is that it is a nonerroneous generality that is contradictory, you should reply, â€œEven though it is like that, it is established as being without an object.â€

original: gnod par byed pa'i chad mas nges pa yang yin la dmigs pa med pa nyid dang / lhan cig 'brel pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i chad mas nges pa yang yin la dmigs pa med pa nyid dang / lhan cig 'brel pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The reason is that it is ascertained by a valid cognition that invalidates it and it is related to the absence of an object.

original: de'i phyir ro de nyid ces bya ba ni nged 'dod pa'o //ğŸ”½dmigs pa med pa nyid ni de nyid la @266a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir ro de nyid ces bya ba ni nged 'dod pa'o // dmigs pa med pa nyid ni de nyid la @266a * //
translated: Therefore, that very thing is what we accept.

original: brjod de / gang zhig gcig la yang ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: brjod de / gang zhig gcig la yang ma nges pa'o //
translated: The very absence of an objective referent is expressed in that very statement, since it is not ascertained in any one thing.

original: khyed kyis 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can nye bar bkod pa de nyid bsgrubs te /
analyzed: khyed kyis 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can nye bar bkod pa de nyid bsgrubs te /
translated: You have set forth an inconsistency that is not erroneous, and that very thing is established.

original: des na bdag cag gi 'dod pa nyid bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na bdag cag gi 'dod pa nyid bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, our assertion is established.

original: 'di la yang 'grel pa khas blangs nas brjod par zad kyi /
analyzed: 'di la yang 'grel pa khas blangs nas brjod par zad kyi /
translated: Here, it is merely stated by accepting the commentary.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang shes pa nyid 'grel pa yang med do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang shes pa nyid 'grel pa yang med do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The commentary on the statement that consciousness has an objective referent is also non-existent.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba la'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba la'o //
translated: This is stated in the phrase â€œconsciousness has an objective referent.â€

original: dmigs pa med pa la yang ji ltar 'brel pa yod snyam na /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa la yang ji ltar 'brel pa yod snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that there is no relation in the absence of an objective referent,

original: gnyis ka yang zhes bya ba ste sad pa dang rmi lam gyi shes pa gnyis ka yang ngo //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang zhes bya ba ste sad pa dang rmi lam gyi shes pa gnyis ka yang ngo //
translated: the phrase â€œboth of theseâ€ refers to both waking and dream consciousnesses.

original: gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don to //
analyzed: gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don to //
translated: â€œOtherâ€ refers to external objects.

original: de bzhin du sad pa'i shes pa la yang rang gi ngo bo rig pa tsam zhig tu mthong ngo //ğŸ”½gal te rmi lam gyi snang ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du sad pa'i shes pa la yang rang gi ngo bo rig pa tsam zhig tu mthong ngo // gal te rmi lam gyi snang ba ni /
translated: Likewise, in the case of the waking state, one sees that the consciousness is aware of its own nature alone.ğŸ”½If one objects that,

original: gzhan gyis ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the appearances in a dream are not perceived by others,

original: rang gi rang bzhin tsam rig par 'thad kyi sad pa'i shes pa la ji ltar te gzhan gyis kyang dmigs pa'i phyir ro snyam nas sad par snang ba'i rig pa yang zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: gal te nye bar mkho ba'i chas mtshungs so zhe na /
