original: rmi lam dang sad pa'i gnas skabs gnyis tha mi dad pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam dang sad pa'i gnas skabs gnyis tha mi dad pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: then the two states, the state of dreaming and the state of being awake, are not different.

original: des na chod pa'i bag chags nyid sad par snang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na chod pa'i bag chags nyid sad par snang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the latent impressions that are blocked are the cause of the appearance of being awake,

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis dgag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis dgag pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not the case that the existence of the dream is refuted merely on the ground of nonperception.

original: 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid kyis gnyis gang yin pa de ldog pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid kyis gnyis gang yin pa de ldog pa'i tshe na /
translated: When the two, characterized by death, cease,

original: skye ba nyid rmi lam dang 'dra bas rmi lam ste /
analyzed: skye ba nyid rmi lam dang 'dra bas rmi lam ste /
translated: birth itself is like a dream, so it is a dream.

original: de ltar ci'i phyir mi rtogs te rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar ci'i phyir mi rtogs te rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: Why donâ€™t you understand it that way? You certainly do understand it that way!

original: 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid kyis log pa yin mod /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid kyis log pa yin mod /
translated: â€œBut it is death that is characterized by cessation!â€

original: de las cis 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: de las cis 'grub snyam na /
translated: What is established by that?

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rmi lam bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rmi lam bzhin du'o //
translated: â€œIn that wayâ€ means â€œlike a dream.â€

original: gnyid log pa sad pa las nyin la sna tshogs pa mthong ba cis ni ma yin /
analyzed: gnyid log pa sad pa las nyin la sna tshogs pa mthong ba cis ni ma yin /
translated: Why is it not the case that what is seen in a dream is the cause for seeing various things on waking?

original: sngar gyi 'gyur na /
analyzed: sngar gyi 'gyur na /
translated: In the earlier translation,

original: mthong ba gang yin pa de ni phyis don mthong ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba gang yin pa de ni phyis don mthong ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: â€œwhat is seen is the cause for seeing objects later.â€

original: des na rmi lam dang rmi lam ma yin pa dag mtshungs so //
analyzed: des na rmi lam dang rmi lam ma yin pa dag mtshungs so //
translated: Therefore, dreams and non-dreams are the same.

original: snga na med pa'i yang sad pa'i gnas skabs na mthong ngo @268a * //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i yang sad pa'i gnas skabs na mthong ngo @268a * // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œWhat was not there before is seen on waking.â€

original: de lta yin pa zhes bya ba ni snga na med pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin pa zhes bya ba ni snga na med pa mthong ba'o //
translated: â€œThat is soâ€ means â€œwhat was not there before is seen.â€

original: rmi lam du 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mthang la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba de la yang snga na med pa'i don dmigs pa yod pa de bzhin du sad pa'i rmi lam du yang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba snga na med pa'i dmigs par byed pa ci mi
analyzed: rmi lam du 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mthang la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba de la yang snga na med pa'i don dmigs pa yod pa de bzhin du sad pa'i rmi lam du yang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba snga na med pa'i dmigs par byed pa ci mi
translated: Just as in a dream, one sees going and coming, and the nonexistence of the object of the prior nonexistence of going and coming, in the same way, one should accept that in the waking state, too, one sees going and coming, and the nonexistence of the object of the prior nonexistence of going and coming.

original: 'dod / mtshungs par bsgrubs nas gnod byed gzhan yang gnod pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod / mtshungs par bsgrubs nas gnod byed gzhan yang gnod pa ni /
translated: Having established the equivalence, CandrakÄ«rti states another objection:

original: skad cig ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The momentariness of things is accepted by the opponent.

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The tenet is that it is so.

original: bdag nyid kyis bdag 'khor ba nyid du dmigs pa des na /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis bdag 'khor ba nyid du dmigs pa des na /
translated: Since the self itself is observed to be in cyclic existence,

original: ji ltar gnyid log pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyid log pa yin /
translated: how can it be asleep?

original: gal te gnyid rtsom pa na /
analyzed: gal te gnyid rtsom pa na /
translated: If it is claimed that when sleep begins,

original: bdag nyid 'khor ba nyid du ma dmigs te /
analyzed: bdag nyid 'khor ba nyid du ma dmigs te /
translated: the self is not observed to be in cyclic existence,

original: des na gnyid log pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na gnyid log pa kho na'o //
translated: then it is only asleep.

original: dang po gnyid log ces smos so //
analyzed: dang po gnyid log ces smos so //
translated: First, it is said that it is asleep.

original: nye bar sbyor ba ma yin pa ni rmi lam mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar sbyor ba ma yin pa ni rmi lam mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not engaged because dreams are not seen.

original: rmi lam du mthong ba mi bden par brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam du mthong ba mi bden par brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: What is seen in a dream should be said to be false.

original: dang po'i dus na ni rmi lam mthong ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dang po'i dus na ni rmi lam mthong ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: At the time of the first sleep, the seeing of dreams does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe rmi lam mthong ba de'i tshe ni bdag nyid gsal bar mthong ba na ji ltar gnyid kyis log pa nyid log pa nyid du rtogs par byed /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rmi lam mthong ba de'i tshe ni bdag nyid gsal bar mthong ba na ji ltar gnyid kyis log pa nyid log pa nyid du rtogs par byed /
translated: When one sees a dream, at that time, since one sees oneself clearly, how does one know that one is asleep?

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni dang po'i gnyid log pa gang yin pa de nyid rmi lam du mthong ba'i rnam pa de'i rgyu yin pa de des nyams par byas pa'i phyir mi bden pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni dang po'i gnyid log pa gang yin pa de nyid rmi lam du mthong ba'i rnam pa de'i rgyu yin pa de des nyams par byas pa'i phyir mi bden pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that the very first sleep is the cause of the appearances seen in the dream, and since it is impaired by that, it is false.

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dang po gnyid log pa khyad par med kyang rmi lam khyad par can du mthong ba'i phyir dang po gnyid rtsom pa ni rmi lam gyi mthong ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dang po gnyid log pa khyad par med kyang rmi lam khyad par can du mthong ba'i phyir dang po gnyid rtsom pa ni rmi lam gyi mthong ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The reply is â€œNo,â€ because even though the first sleep is undifferentiated, the dream is seen as differentiated. The first beginning of sleep is not the cause of the seeing of dreams,

original: gnyid rtsom pa ni de med na rmi lam gyi mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyid rtsom pa ni de med na rmi lam gyi mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it did not exist, the seeing of dreams would not exist.

original: gnyid rtsom pa ni rgyu nyid do zhe na rgyu mtshan tsam zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnyid rtsom pa ni rgyu nyid do zhe na rgyu mtshan tsam zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you say that the cause is the beginning of sleep, then it is merely a reason.

original: des na gnyid rtsom pa ni rmi lam gyi khyad par gyi rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir des bskyed pas mi bden pa nyid du brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: des na gnyid rtsom pa ni rmi lam gyi khyad par gyi rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir des bskyed pas mi bden pa nyid du brjod par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, since the beginning of sleep is not the cause of the particulars of dreams, it cannot be said that they are not real because they are produced by that.

original: sun 'byin par gzhan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: sun 'byin par gzhan brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement of another refutation:

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: â€œThis alsoâ€ means

original: sad par mngon par 'dod pa yang ngo //
analyzed: sad par mngon par 'dod pa yang ngo //
translated: the desire to wake up.

original: gzhan gyis sad na zhes smras te ;
analyzed: gzhan gyis sad na zhes smras te ;
translated: â€œIf another wakes him upâ€ is stated.

original: sad nas dpa' snang ba yin pa des na ji ltar mtshungs snyam na /
analyzed: sad nas dpa' snang ba yin pa des na ji ltar mtshungs snyam na /
translated: Since he is awake and sees the appearance, how can it be the same?

original: 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not so, he says.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba sad do zhes rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba sad do zhes rtogs pa'o //
translated: â€œThusâ€ means he wakes up.

original: mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The conclusion is â€œTherefore.â€

original: de zhes bya ba ni bram ze'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bram ze'o //
translated: â€œThatâ€ refers to the brahmin.

original: ji ltar snyam na brjod pa de'i khyad par zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar snyam na brjod pa de'i khyad par zhes gsungs so //
translated: How? He says, â€œThe particulars of that.â€

original: phyin ci @268b log tu zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa las phyin ci log tu dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du grub pa'o ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci @268b log tu zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa las phyin ci log tu dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du grub pa'o ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: â€œIn a distorted wayâ€ means that it is established that it is associated with an object of apprehension in a way that is distorted from the absence of an object of apprehension. â€œIt is notâ€ is the refutation.

original: ji ltar ka ba la sogs pa'i yul can sad pa'i shes pa la sogs par snang ba med pa de bzhin du rmi lam gyi shes pa la yang log par snang ba med par thal lo //
analyzed: ji ltar ka ba la sogs pa'i yul can sad pa'i shes pa la sogs par snang ba med pa de bzhin du rmi lam gyi shes pa la yang log par snang ba med par thal lo //
translated: Just as the object of a vase, etc., does not appear in the consciousness of one who is awake, in the same way, it follows that the false appearance does not exist in the consciousness of one who is dreaming.

original: de ltar gyur mod snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur mod snyam na /
translated: If you think that this is so,

original: de lta na yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: then NÄgÄrjuna says, â€œEven so,â€

original: log par snang ba med na yang ngo //ğŸ”½dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid la gnod par byed pa'i shes pa mngon sum gyis mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: log par snang ba med na yang ngo // dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid la gnod par byed pa'i shes pa mngon sum gyis mi dmigs pa ni /
translated: even though there is no false appearance.

original: shes pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis gzhan du bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis gzhan du bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The nonobservation of a consciousness that contradicts the existence of an object of apprehension cannot be accomplished by a reason such as â€œbecause of being a consciousness,â€

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum gyis gnod byed du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum gyis gnod byed du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: because an inference cannot contradict a direct perception.

original: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid dmigs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid dmigs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The so-called non-apprehension is the nature of apprehension.

original: 'di nyid la dpe brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid la dpe brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: An example of this is given: â€œIf, etc.â€

original: bzlog pa la ni me med pa la'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa la ni me med pa la'o //
translated: The opposite is: â€œin the absence of fire.â€

original: de ci rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin nam /
analyzed: de ci rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin nam /
translated: Is this an inference?

original: de bzhin du shes pa nyid la sogs pa las tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa nyid la sogs pa las tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, knowledge, etc., are not valid cognitions.

original: ci zla ba gnyis kyi yul can de mngon sum du 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci zla ba gnyis kyi yul can de mngon sum du 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Is the cognition of the two moons a perception?

original: 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: No, it is not.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te sngar gcig tu ma mthong na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te sngar gcig tu ma mthong na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if one had not previously seen the one moon,

original: gal te snga rjes su dpag pa med na mngon sum yang med par 'gyur ba'i phyir mtshungs so zhe na mngon sun ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te snga rjes su dpag pa med na mngon sum yang med par 'gyur ba'i phyir mtshungs so zhe na mngon sun ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you say that it is the same, because if there were no prior inference, there would be no perception, we reply: Perception, etc.

original: gal te mngon sum rjes su dpag pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum rjes su dpag pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin na /
translated: If perception is preceded by inference,

original: de'i tshe mngon sum gyi yul de yang rjes su dpag pa nyid gnod byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe mngon sum gyi yul de yang rjes su dpag pa nyid gnod byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the object of perception would be invalidated by inference itself.

original: de ltar 'gyur nyid ci 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur nyid ci 'gal zhe na /
translated: What is the contradiction in that?

original: de lta na yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: In that case, too, he says.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni mngon sum las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni mngon sum las so //
translated: From that means from perception.

original: snang ba'i rang bzhin don byed pa dang lhan cig 'brel pa rjes su dpag pas gzung na ste /
analyzed: snang ba'i rang bzhin don byed pa dang lhan cig 'brel pa rjes su dpag pas gzung na ste /
translated: When the nature of appearance, which is connected with the performance of a function, is apprehended by inference,

original: khyad par can gyi chos can gyi mthar thug pa'i 'grel pa dran pa na /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi chos can gyi mthar thug pa'i 'grel pa dran pa na /
translated: and the memory of the ultimate subject with a distinguishing feature is recalled,

original: mngon sum 'jug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum 'jug par byed pa yin no //
translated: then perception is engaged.

original: grub pa'i mtha' pas gal te de lta na zhes smos so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' pas gal te de lta na zhes smos so //
translated: The one who holds the philosophical position says, If that is so, then.

original: 'o na khyed kyi lta ba la tshad ma ma yin pa kho nar thal lo zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na khyed kyi lta ba la tshad ma ma yin pa kho nar thal lo zhe na /
translated: Well, then, it follows that your view is not a valid cognition at all.

original: 'di bshad zin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di bshad zin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This has been explained, he says.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa kho na ste /
translated: This is precisely what is accepted,

original: mi 'dod pa ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: and not what is not accepted, he thinks.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i yul gyi tshad ma yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i yul gyi tshad ma yang ngo //
translated: And that means that a valid cognition with a different object is also.

original: gal te ji ltar mngon sum rang gi yul la rjes su dpag pa med par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rjes @269a * //
analyzed: gal te ji ltar mngon sum rang gi yul la rjes su dpag pa med par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rjes @269a * //
translated: so too inference engages its object without being invalidated by direct perception,

original: su dpag pa yang mngon sum med pa kho na rang gi yul la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni rjes su dpag pa yang gnod /
analyzed: su dpag pa yang mngon sum med pa kho na rang gi yul la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni rjes su dpag pa yang gnod /
translated: then the response to that is: â€œInference is also invalidated.â€ğŸ”½The meaning of this is as follows: It is only with regard to a specific object that it can be said that it is invalidated or not invalidated.

original: gang zhig gang gi yul yin pa de nyid la de'i gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po bsam par bya ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bsams nas smra ba ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mtha' pas 'jug parğŸ”½zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi yul yin pa de nyid la de'i gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po bsam par bya ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bsams nas smra ba ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mtha' pas 'jug par zhes gsungs so //
translated: The one who speaks having thought, â€œIt is not otherwise,â€ is the one who engages in the tenets of the treatise.

original: gal te mngon sum ni 'dzin pa nyid kyi tshad mar 'thad pa ma yin nam snyam na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum ni 'dzin pa nyid kyi tshad mar 'thad pa ma yin nam snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is not tenable that direct perception is a valid knowledge that apprehends,

original: 'dzin par byed pa yin na ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa yin na ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: then the response to that is: â€œIf it is an apprehender.â€

original: de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The one who establishes the treatise in this way is the one who engages in the tenets of the treatise.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: â€œ Thatâ€ refers to the future object to be attained.

original: rang gi ngo bos thob pa'i don la ji ltar 'jug gal te dngos po'i rang gi ngo bos thob kyang don bya ba ma thob pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½de don du gnyer bas 'jug go zhe na 'o na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos thob pa'i don la ji ltar 'jug gal te dngos po'i rang gi ngo bos thob kyang don bya ba ma thob pa'i phyir / de don du gnyer bas 'jug go zhe na 'o na zhes gsungs so //
translated: How could one engage in the object obtained by its own nature?ğŸ”½If one says that although the object is obtained by the entity's own nature, one engages in it because one seeks the object that is not obtained, then the response is Well then...

original: skyes bu gang la don bya ba gsal bar te 'dra ba de yang don bya ba thob pa'i don du 'jug go zhe na thob po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skyes bu gang la don bya ba gsal bar te 'dra ba de yang don bya ba thob pa'i don du 'jug go zhe na thob po zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one says that a person engages in the object that is obtained in order to obtain the object that is not obtained, the response is It is obtained.

original: de la zhes bya ba thob par bya ba mi gsal ba la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba thob par bya ba mi gsal ba la'o //
translated: In that refers to the unclear object to be obtained.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i don la'o //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i don la'o //
translated: Also in that refers to the different object.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: That refers to inference.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni long ba brgyud pa las byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni long ba brgyud pa las byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa la'o //
translated: In that refers to inference arising from a series of blind people.

original: pha rol po nyid sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: pha rol po nyid sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Anticipating the opponent's doubt that the Buddha is a Buddhist,

original: zla ba ni gnyis kyi yul can gyi shes pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi gnod pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: zla ba ni gnyis kyi yul can gyi shes pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi gnod pa yin no snyam na /
translated: if one thinks that the moon is harmed by another because the consciousness that has the two moons as its object is not a direct perception,

original: pha rol po 'dri ba ci'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol po 'dri ba ci'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent asks, â€œWhy?â€

original: 'di la sangs rgyas pa'i lan ni gnod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la sangs rgyas pa'i lan ni gnod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Buddhist replies, â€œBecause it is undermined.â€

original: 'di la gzhan gyis phan tshun zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyis phan tshun zhes smras so //
translated: The opponent says, â€œThey are mutually dependent.â€

original: sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The Buddhist anticipates the opponentâ€™s objection:

original: zla ba ni gnyis kyi yul can gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba ni gnyis kyi yul can gyi shes pa'o //
translated: â€œThe cognition of two moons has two moons as its object.â€

original: phan tshun ltos nas gnyis ka la yang gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa yang 'gyur zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos nas gnyis ka la yang gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa yang 'gyur zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The Buddhist replies, â€œIf they are mutually dependent, then both the object and the cognition are undermined.â€

original: 'di grub pa'i mtha' 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di grub pa'i mtha' 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Buddhist says, â€œThis is not a refutation of our philosophical tenet.â€

original: gcig ni zhes bya ba ni dus phyis byung ba zla ba gcig gi yul can no //
analyzed: gcig ni zhes bya ba ni dus phyis byung ba zla ba gcig gi yul can no //
translated: â€œ The otherâ€ refers to the cognition of one moon that arises later.

original: 'di ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: â€œ This must be accepted.â€

original: de ltar ma yin na mngon sum gzhan gyi gnod pas skabs nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na mngon sum gzhan gyi gnod pas skabs nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not accept this, then the opponentâ€™s undermining of the first cognition will be undermined.

original: de lta yin mod de lta na yang zla ba gcig gi yul can gyi zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa gnod do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de lta yin mod de lta na yang zla ba gcig gi yul can gyi zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa gnod do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: â€œ Even though this is so, the cognition of two moons undermines the cognition of one moon.â€

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œIn that caseâ€ means:

original: zla ba @269b gnyis kyi shes pa la thob par bya ba med do zhes zla ba gcig gi yul can gyi shes pas shes pa yin la de yang rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: zla ba @269b gnyis kyi shes pa la thob par bya ba med do zhes zla ba gcig gi yul can gyi shes pas shes pa yin la de yang rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no //
translated: The cognition of two moons does not have an object to be attained, because it is cognized by the cognition of the object of one moon, and that is the object of inference.

original: des na de la gnod na rjes su dpag pa nyid la gnod pa ma yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na de la gnod na rjes su dpag pa nyid la gnod pa ma yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, when that is refuted, inference itself is not refuted.

original: lan brjod pa ni rang gi ngo bo la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan brjod pa ni rang gi ngo bo la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is â€œbecause of the nature of the object.â€

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa nyid la'o //
translated: â€œIn that caseâ€ means in the case of the object to be established being observed as having the same nature.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang des bslang ba'i rjes su dpag pa tha mi dad pa dmigs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba ni'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang des bslang ba'i rjes su dpag pa tha mi dad pa dmigs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba ni'o //
translated: â€œThatâ€ means direct perception and the inference induced by it, which are not different.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa tha dad par sgrub pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa tha dad par sgrub pa la'o //
translated: â€œIn that caseâ€ means in the case of establishing a different object.

original: rtsa na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rjes su dpag pa yin la ;
analyzed: rtsa na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rjes su dpag pa yin la ;
translated: Because it does not exist in the basis. This is an inference.

original: de yang 'ga' zhig tu mngon sum gyis ma dmigs pa tha dad pa gzhan du ma dmigs pa des na 'di ni rtsa ba med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang 'ga' zhig tu mngon sum gyis ma dmigs pa tha dad pa gzhan du ma dmigs pa des na 'di ni rtsa ba med pa kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, in some places, the non-observation of a direct perception is a different non-observation. By that, this is only without a root.

original: gal te mi sogs gnod byed kyi blo bzhin zhes bya ba'i dpe yang mi 'thad do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: gal te mi sogs gnod byed kyi blo bzhin zhes bya ba'i dpe yang mi 'thad do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Also, the example, â€œlike the mind that is harmed by a non-human,â€ is not tenable.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is shown by â€œin dreams, etc.â€

original: rmi lam la sogs pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de la gnod par byed pa sad pa'i blo gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de la gnod par byed pa sad pa'i blo gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: In dreams, etc., that have an object, the mind of waking that is a harm-doer is without an object.ğŸ”½That very non-objectification, which is the mind of waking that is a different consciousness, is a consciousness.ğŸ”½â€œThatâ€ is the non-objectification that is the mind of waking.

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid gang yin pa shes pa gzhan sad pa'i rnam par shes par gyur pa de la gnas pa de ni shes pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa des bskyed pa'i blo 'dis so ;
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid gang yin pa shes pa gzhan sad pa'i rnam par shes par gyur pa de la gnas pa de ni shes pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa des bskyed pa'i blo 'dis so ;
translated: â€œThisâ€ is the mind that is produced by that.

original: / de ni zhes bya ba ni shes pa gzhan la gnas pa'i dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: / de ni zhes bya ba ni shes pa gzhan la gnas pa'i dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: â€œThatâ€ is the non-objectification that is the mind of waking.

original: des na rjes su dpog pa'i blo'i dpe nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa'i blo la de las gzhan pa sad pa'i shes pa yang bsgrub par bya ba tha dad pa gang yin pa de'i yul can nyid yin te /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpog pa'i blo'i dpe nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa'i blo la de las gzhan pa sad pa'i shes pa yang bsgrub par bya ba tha dad pa gang yin pa de'i yul can nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, the mind that infers the existence of the dream state from the example of the mind that infers the existence of the waking state is the subject that realizes the existence of another state, the waking state, which is different from the dream state.

original: des na lan gyi tshad ma med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na lan gyi tshad ma med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: So how can it be that there is no valid cognition that can respond to the argument?

original: 'di la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the response is â€œIf you say that . . . .â€

original: de yang zhes bya ba sad pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba sad pa'i blo'o //
translated: â€œThatâ€ refers to the waking mind.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba tha dad pa'i dmigs pa can du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba tha dad pa'i dmigs pa can du'o //
translated: â€œIn that wayâ€ refers to having a different object.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i blo'o //
translated: â€œThisâ€ refers to the mind that infers the existence of the object.

original: de las bzlog pa'i zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan sad pa'i blo gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan sad pa'i blo gang yin pa de'o //
translated: â€œThe opposite of thatâ€ refers to the waking mind that is different from the dream state.

original: 'di ni khas blangs nas brjod par zad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni khas blangs nas brjod par zad kyi /
translated: This is just a response that accepts the premise.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i blo dmigs pa med par sgrub par byed pa 'di ni tha dad par zhes bya ba gzhan la gnas pa'i dmigs pa med pa nyid sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i blo dmigs pa med par sgrub par byed pa 'di ni tha dad par zhes bya ba gzhan la gnas pa'i dmigs pa med pa nyid sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: This proof that the inferential cognition is without an objective support does not prove that the objective support is nonexistent in another, i.e., in something different.

original: tha dad sgrub pa nyid ston pa ni tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½gzhan las cig shos la dmigs @270a * //
analyzed: tha dad sgrub pa nyid ston pa ni tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o // gzhan las cig shos la dmigs @270a * //
translated: The word â€œdifferentâ€ shows that the proof is of something different.

original: pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //ğŸ”½rjes su dpag pa'i blo de ni mi 'khrul par te /
analyzed: pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to // rjes su dpag pa'i blo de ni mi 'khrul par te /
translated: The other, i.e., the other, the inferential cognition, has an objective support in itself, i.e., in its own nature.

original: mi slu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi slu bar byed pa'o //
translated: This inferential cognition is non-erroneous, i.e., non-deceptive.

original: gal te mi slu ba 'di yang nam gyi tshe 'gyur snyam na /ğŸ”½mi 'khrul pa de yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te mi slu ba 'di yang nam gyi tshe 'gyur snyam na / mi 'khrul pa de yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: When is it non-deceptive?

original: rang gi rang bzhin gyi dmigs pa'i yul can de la yang rang gi ngo bo nyams su myong bar mngon par zhen pa lhag par zhen pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin gyi dmigs pa'i yul can de la yang rang gi ngo bo nyams su myong bar mngon par zhen pa lhag par zhen pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: That non-erroneous cognition, i.e., the inferential cognition, has an objective support in its own nature, i.e., in its own form. The adherence to the experience of its own nature is called â€œadherence to that.â€

original: rnam par rtog pa'i mi slu ba de ni de kho na yin gyi gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mi slu ba de ni de kho na yin gyi gzhan ni med do //
translated: That non-deceptive conceptualization is reality, and there is no other.

original: rnam par rtog pa gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na rjes su dpag pa'i blo de ni de'i bdag nyid kyi dmigs pa med pa nyid rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na rjes su dpag pa'i blo de ni de'i bdag nyid kyi dmigs pa med pa nyid rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: And since that is so, the inferential cognition is what causes one to understand the non-existence of the object that has the nature of that.

original: dmigs pa rnam pa nyid dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i sgo nas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam pa nyid dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i sgo nas brjod pa ni /
translated: The negation and affirmation of the object itself is stated as follows:

original: da ltar shes pa gzhan la gnas pa'i dmigs pa nyid de ni nga la 'dir snang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar shes pa gzhan la gnas pa'i dmigs pa nyid de ni nga la 'dir snang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: â€œThe object itself, which is present in another cognition, is not manifest to me here.

original: 'on kyang bdag ni rang gi rnam pa'i mthar thug pa yin no zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag ni rang gi rnam pa'i mthar thug pa yin no zhes bya bar ro //
translated: However, I am the ultimate form of my own aspect.â€

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med par sgrub pa'i blo ste /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med par sgrub pa'i blo ste /
translated: â€œThisâ€ refers to the cognition that establishes the non-existence of the object.

original: 'di nyid dmigs pa dang bcas par ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di nyid dmigs pa dang bcas par ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not established as having an object, because it itself is not established as having an object.

original: da ni gal te de'i rang bzhin zhes bya bas rnam 'grel la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: da ni gal te de'i rang bzhin zhes bya bas rnam 'grel la 'jug par byed do //
translated: Now, beginning with â€œIf it has that nature,â€ he introduces the PramaÌ„nï¬ avaÌ„rtika.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni shes pa gzhan la gnas pa'i dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni shes pa gzhan la gnas pa'i dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Its nature is the nonexistence of the object of consciousness that is present in another consciousness.

original: 'di la lan ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la lan ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is â€œIn that case . . . â€

original: 'o na ji ltar rig par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa snyam na /ğŸ”½skra sogs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rig par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa snyam na / skra sogs zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it is asked, â€œHow is the conceptual thought that perceives it?â€ğŸ”½the response is â€œThe conceptual thought that perceives . . . â€

original: 'on te skra shad la sogs pa rig par bya ba'i dngos po ma yin pa nyid du ci ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: 'on te skra shad la sogs pa rig par bya ba'i dngos po ma yin pa nyid du ci ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: If it is asked, â€œHow is it established that the object of perception, such as the appearance of falling hair, is not a real entity?â€

original: skra shad la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skra shad la zhes gsungs so //
translated: the response is â€œThe appearance of falling hair . . . â€

original: 'di las kyang zhes bya ba ni 'chad bzhin pa'i rigs las so gang yin par zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: 'di las kyang zhes bya ba ni 'chad bzhin pa'i rigs las so gang yin par zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
translated: The phrase â€œin this caseâ€ refers to the type of reasoning that is being presented. The phrase â€œin what wayâ€ means â€œbecause.â€

original: des ni zhes bya ba ni skra shad kyi shes pa la sogs pa'i dpes so //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba ni skra shad kyi shes pa la sogs pa'i dpes so //
translated: The phrase â€œin that caseâ€ refers to the example of the consciousness of falling hair, and so on.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni gzhan la yang zhugs pa ni thob par mngon par rlom pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni gzhan la yang zhugs pa ni thob par mngon par rlom pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The phrase â€œin another caseâ€ means â€œin another situation.â€ The phrase â€œto engage inâ€ means â€œto have the characteristic of conceiving of the attainment of.â€

original: gal te rang bzhin 'ga' zhig thun mong yin pa'i phyir na dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro zhe na dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin 'ga' zhig thun mong yin pa'i phyir na dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro zhe na dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you say that the object is established because it is the common nature of the cognition, then he says, â€œThe object is not established.â€ğŸ”½If it were not so,

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin snang na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin snang na'o //
translated: then the nature of the object would appear.

original: thob par bya ba de snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob par bya ba de snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that object would appear.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni yang snang ba de yang snang ba yin na'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni yang snang ba de yang snang ba yin na'o //
translated: And that appearance would also appear.ğŸ”½There would be an infinite regress.

original: thug pa med do zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis yang 'di skad @270b ces yang snang ba'i don du 'jug go zhes brjod par bya ba de la yang lan 'di nyid yin pas thug pa med do //
analyzed: thug pa med do zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis yang 'di skad @270b ces yang snang ba'i don du 'jug go zhes brjod par bya ba de la yang lan 'di nyid yin pas thug pa med do //
translated: You would have to say that the appearance of that appearance would be the object, and that would also have to appear, and so on.
